intro: Galium pedemontanum var. longepilosum, commonly known as the long-hairy bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and covered with fine, long hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
